Reviews.Title: Great daylight photos.  Hunts for focus in med room lighting situations
Reviews.Author: M. Winschel
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 4/2014 - I have found a significant drawback with this unit that has really taken the lustre off of the camera and has left me very disappointed.  The unit stinks in low light.  It will hunt for focus and not find it, flash or no flash.  It doesnt even have to be very low lighting conditions.  I have used other canon and nikon units and they do not have the same issue.  The camera has been getting significantly less usage since that.  I still really like it for daylight shots but look elsewhere or try it before you keep it if standard indoor room lighting levels are important to you.  If it were not for the lenses purchased I would have returned it to costco and looked for something else.Original review:Purchased this unit from costco after researching reviews on comparable Nikon and Canon units.  All but one of the tech reviews raved about this camera.  The plus side is the unit is "weather proof" (still not sure how that is defined).  The reviews in general favored this unit in overall image quality over the Canon T5i rebel which was the other unit I was comparing it to.  This was less expensive than the Canon and weatherproof.  Out of the box the unit is very easy to pick up and start shooting with if you have any experience with DSLR cameras.  Very intuitive menu design.  Overall build feels very solid and fits my hands well.  Photo quality is amazing in the little bit of playing I have done with it.  I need to work on learning the advanced features of the unit (which are many) to do a better job on exposure.  I was seeing my subjects under exposed a bit in daylight.  Playing with some of the settings has helped. I don't fault the camera for this, but my relative inexperience.  I coupled this two lens set with a fast 50 lens for portrait shooting.  Going off topic: I LOVE this lens.  First prime lens and am really impressed with the bokeh effect I am capable of producing, nothing less than stunning with this camera.  The combination has really been a huge step up in what I can produce over my D50.  Going off topic again:I also added a class 10 eye-fi card 16gb for instant photo transfer.  Love it.  Third unit and to me they are very easy to setup and use, never had an issue with them. I have seen nothing negative yet about the camera.  Like the color combinations.  Got mine in white and it looks classy.  I need to dig in and learn how to really unleash the potential of the camera.I am excited about the "weather proof" aspects of the design and need to learn more about it.  I purchased an Olympus Tough TG1 last year for less than perfect and underwater conditions and it does the job it's designed to do well but lacks the control and overall image quality of a DSLR.  Being able to take this outside without paranoia over any exposure to the elements weighed heavily in my decision over the Canon and Nikon (I was really leaning towards the Canon after having used it).  Just make sure that the lenses you are going to use carry the weather proof rating also. The fast 50 does not.I am really looking forward to learning this camera better and have no regrets over buying it sight unseen over the canon and nikons.  So far I am amazed with the quality of shots that I have produced. I will update this later when I get a little more time with the unit.

Reviews.Title: The perfect first time DSLR
Reviews.Author: Laurence83
Reviews.Content: I just finished 2 years of shooting all over the world with my Canon EOS 60D.  That camera was the best DSLR that I had handled in a long time, and bested Nikons 5200 by a long shot in my opinion.  I now shoot wildlife and outdoor sporting photography and needed something that could stand up to the elements and provide high quality photos.  This Pentax K30 and K50 series of cameras fit this bill perfectly, and after much consideration I went with the K50.  I also purchased another WR lens in 200mm to accompany this one.  The K50 body and both lenses have proven to exceed my expectations of a camera and lens system in this price range.  These products easily compete with Canons and Nikons that sell for twice the cost.  All specs aside, the focusing is fast and precise, the options are very extensive but lack in some areas compared to other makes, and the end result has pleased me over and over again without fail.  If you need a camera to take on a rafting trip, rainy day, or want something that can hold up to dust storms in Iraq/Afghanistan, this is the clear choice for you.  As a military contractor and avid amateur photographer, this camera suits my needs perfectly, and produces images at equal quality to my EOS 60D which cost me $1200.  I paid $450 for this kit because the seller sold me a returned product and Amazon provided me with a 20% refund due to that.  My point and shoot cost more than that, so I am beyond happy with this purchase and look forward to years of shooting with this very competitively priced and engineered marvel of a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Pentax makes great cameras - don't think everything is all Canon and Nikon
Reviews.Author: MC
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a month and love it!  A professional photographer recommended it to me and at first I was a little hesitant because it was hard to find in stores and it wasn't as popular as Canon or Nikon models. But I'm very happy I went with a Pentax.  It's the first time I've bought a DSLR and so far, it's been pretty easy to use.  I'm still playing around with some of the settings, but overall, it's been great.  I had been using a Canon Rebel (that I basically had inherited) and this takes MUCH better pictures.  Brighter colors, better flash, faster, etc. My main purpose of this camera is to take photos for my child's elementary school yearbook and I'm really impressed by how they look so far.  It has a lot of great filters and effect settings and I find the menu is easy to use.  I also love that it's weatherproof.  A previous point and shoot camera that I had ended up getting dust inside and became unusable.  I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Big Step Up from K200D
Reviews.Author: J. Ramnes
Reviews.Content: I had been shooting with a K200D for about 4 years. While it was a good camera, it needed improvement in a few areas, specifically high ISO performance, focus speed and accuracy, and live view. The K50 offered all these things.With about 500 shots through the new camera, I can say it has exceeded my expectations, especially in the focus and live view areas. Low light performance is much better than the old camera but still not what the high end units offer.I also got the 18-135 lens and LOVE that as well. It has become my go to lens for almost all situations, replacing the 55-300 which I used to use about 80 percent of the time. That lens still performs well on the new camera but the shorter zoom is much more versatile and very sharp when stopped down one or two stops.The controls are different than the K200D, especially the two control wheels rather than one. I am getting used to this and will love it when it becomes second nature. I also like the quicker access to ISO and other settings that is available.Am using the AA battery adapter with Energizer Lithiums and continue to get excellent performance from them.Very pleased, would buy the camera again and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: The Alternative that Isn't
Reviews.Author: bsamcash
Reviews.Content: A simply spectacular tool. I am a Pentaxian for sure, but I have used many other brands including the Big Two, and nothing comes close at this price point. You get a modern update of the highly acclaimed 16 MP Sony sensor in a fully weather-sealed body with a matching (high quality) kit lens for under $700!The body is unbelievable rugged for being plastic. It makes every other DSLR in its price range feel like a cheap toy. Plus, the grip is hands down the best I have ever felt at any price. It hugs my hand and locks in place--no need for a hand strap. The grip and solid, unyielding body are why I chose this model over the K-5II.At low ISOs, the older sensor is on par or maybe a little noisier than competing models, but when the lights go down, this thing shines. Zero noise gain when well exposed, but if you have to push say a 3200 RAW image, you will be blown away at the headroom the K-50 has in its 12 bit files. And if you can find noise (by pushing), it's not that gross banding we are used to seeing with cameras that shoot for marking megapixels rather than image quality. It is a gentle, film-like fine grain in very large prints. And this is for color, if you're converting to B&W;, you can take this thing all the way through its ISO range and make beautiful small prints.The menu system is as near perfect as I can trust engineers to make it. They either are, or work with photographers. Everything you need is one to three clicks away. I tried using a D5200 recently, and I couldn't even figure out how to set it to RAW, I had to look it up. Then ISO took me five minutes. It was ridiculous. I guarantee you will not have this problem with any Pentax DSLR from 2010 to today.The lens is pretty brilliant for a kit lens. It is weather-sealed and solid. The zoom is very well dampened. It feels high-quality. I have used many kit lenses in the past from many manufacturers, and this one is the best. It even beats Panasonic's micro four-thirds kit lens in build. Image quality wise, it's about on par with others; by that I mean it needs to be stopped down to shine. But it is very sharp throughout the range when it has plenty of light.Now for the bad: The out-of-camera JPEGs suck. Pentax has never had great JPEG processing. This sensor begs to be left alone. Shoot RAW and use a calibrated monitor to edit the images (it records in DNG, so there's no worry there).Moreover, this body needs good glass. Please don't be a hipster and buy a high-quality camera and only use the kit lens. This is a serious tool, not a toy, so invest in decent lenses. Luckily, the K-mount has among the most expansive and diverse lens collection in photography (it's why I shoot Pentax). But you don't have to break the bank, just go to your favorite flea market or internet auction site and look for old manual lenses. You'll be surprised and the quality that can be had for under 50 USD.So there it is. My very first ever Amazon product review. Yes, I love this camera that much. It is not just an alternative brand. And this is not an alternative camera at all because the competition doesn't come close at this price.Bottom line: If you are looking for your first DSLR, or if you're considering switching mounts because you're growing tired of the half-adding and broken promises the Big Two have been accused of lately, you cannot go wrong with the Pentax K-50.

Reviews.Title: Extraordinary Value and Camera
Reviews.Author: Joshua Sadinsky
Reviews.Content: Great price for an intermediate level DSLR.  The construction is sturdy and rugged, while being lightweight.  The stock lens is mediocre, but whatever...  Aesthetically, it is slick, suave, cool.What's really great is lens compatibility with old K-mount lenses.  If you have vintage K-mounts lenses, this is the perfect body for you.  Only beware of the infamous Ricoh Pin which in rare situations may cause your lens to become permanently stuck to the body.In a world of photography overshadowed primarily by Nikon and Canon, having something different feels good for a change.If you're indie or a hipster, get this camera.Friendly user interface.  Bright LCD.  Pretty quick performance and memory writing.I am happy with the K-50.

Reviews.Title: Pentax K-50
Reviews.Author: William Johnston
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. It does everything I wanted it to do. Now I can use all of my old Pentax lenses which was not possible with the other brands. Shipment was prompt.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: P. Levine
Reviews.Content: This is my first "real" camera. I have been very pleased with it so far. While I was a bit surprised and disappointed it only came with AA batteries and the battery adapter as opposed to the rechargeable battery, it was easy and inexpensive to pick up a few rechargeable batteries and the charger separately. I've probably only taken about 500 pictures with the camera so far, but the quality with the stock 18-50 lens has been nice. I'm sure there are many camera features of which I've yet to take full advantage. I just spent another $400 to pick up the 55-300 WR HD lens for this, so I do recommend spending the extra $100 or so when you purchase it and making sure the one you get comes with both the 18-50 and 50-200 lenses - which will likely keep you from having to spend the extra money to buy the 55-300mm lens - at least for a while.

Reviews.Title: Excellent upgrade
Reviews.Author: wjo
Reviews.Content: When I dropped my Pentax K2000 on the pavement it set me up to have to buy a replacement.  I wanted to stay in this price range and looked at both the K30 and k50.  I am very happy with my purchase.  The menus are similar so learning this new camera has been pretty easy.  Having video in my dslr is a nice bonus.  One difference in this camera body is the wheel located near the on /off switch. It is taking me awhile to get used to it and it is easy to spin that wheel when I am intending to turn the camera off or on.  I am very pleased with the richness of color that I am able to achieve in my photography using Pentax cameras.  This is my third Pentax, the first was a point and shoot digital that was stolen out of my car, the second hit the pavement and I plan to send in for repair.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Fred Scott
Reviews.Content: Best buy and value.  Love the camera.  I am not a fan of using a camera that is used for taking pictures for making movie shorts.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Chad Hanna
Reviews.Content: Although this is an "entry-level" dslr it is packed with features. If you are considering your first dslr and don't want to break the bank, consider this camera!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher F. Williams
Reviews.Content: My most recent Mid level camera was a Cannon Rebel G, and I loved it.  I wanted to wait to buy a digital camera until the time was right, and the technology was up to speed, and I was going to go with another Cannon model, but remembered I learned everything I know about camera's on a fully manual Pentax.  This camera was less expensive than it's Cannon counterparts, I've had it for two weeks, and I cannot stop playing with it.  It's incredibly user friendly, and just plain fun.  My kit, came with both the 18-55mm and the 50-200mm lenses and both are fantasic when it comes to focus and sharpness.  I have read some complaints about the lack of heft or size, but it's true what they say about size not being everything.  So far I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Better than i expected!
Reviews.Author: A. Jones "sale shopper"
Reviews.Content: I am not camera savvy so I graduated from my Coolpix auto zoom with apprehension. I did my research and decided on the Pentax over the Nikon (they seemed very close) mainly for cosmetic reasons. Upon first powering up it was a little intimidating but I took time and read the manual while playing around with it. I love the fact that if I think I have messed up the Menu button just sends me back home.  The picture quality is beautiful and for my purposes easy to use. It is apparent that the more experienced photographer will enjoy this also. It has so much more than I would ever use.

Reviews.Title: Best Pentax camera I've owned in 35 years.
Reviews.Author: Tom Lottinville
Reviews.Content: The camera is small and ruggedly constructed. Well suited to fast action photography. Controls are conveniently located and easy to use. I would have preferred to have a lock on the mode control dial. 6400 ISO performance is amazing. Menus are extensive and mostly intuitive. The features and modes are more than most people will ever use. I am very disappointed that some of the manufacturer supplied accessories had been removed from the box: Owner instruction manual, Pentax battery and charger. I believe this is a HIGHLY unethical practice.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for out doors and profes
Reviews.Author: Christopher Austin "jeep"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, has that loud mechanical shutter Sound that I love. Feels great in hand and would definitely recommend to other photographers , weather sealing is an awesome touch.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: kisssucks
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR, as I was shooting film before, and I think it was the right choice. It's honestly a better camera than any of the entry level ones from the other manufacturers and is right up there with some of the mid-level ones. I'm a Nikon fanboy but this Pentax has split my allegiance. It's honestly a better camera than the Nikon D7000 and maybe even the D7100 depending on how much you value bragging about megapixels. I'll just skip ahead. Pros: weather sealing, 100% pentaprism, build quality (not a toy like a Rebel and I honestly think it feels better than the Nikon mid-levels), screw drive for old lenses, really nice video in my opinion. Cons: no battery grip (why why why), lens selection is a bit lacking and they need to make some fast and affordable WR lenses, it should ship with a weather sealed body cap for transport. Other than that I can't really gripe much about it. More megapixels might be nice and it actually looks better in person than it does in most of the photos online. I like knowing where things are made and this is assembled in the Philippines. In the end, it's not as sexy as a Nikon but it's built better and I think it obliterates that company when it comes to value.

Reviews.Title: great so far
Reviews.Author: Emily Haupt
Reviews.Content: Great photos.  It'll take some learning to adjust the settings, but I've already taken hundreds of gorgeous photos of primarily family and pets - can't wait to get into the more detailed settings to see what this machine can do!  Love that it has the weather resistant casing, so I don't have to treat it like it's about to break every time I touch it.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera.
Reviews.Author: jleal
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this camera to everyone, amazing quality, great specs and configuration modes, price is reeeaaally good so overall, 10/10  :B

Reviews.Title: I really like this camera!
Reviews.Author: Agucho
Reviews.Content: Very good camera has many functions and management functions is intuitive, front and rear dial to vary the exposure, live view, the kit lens (18-55mm), highlight the value added is sealed for outdoor use, the auto focus is accurate and quiet, built-in flash works well, although I have not tested with a dedicated external flash, the video does not tried much since more interested in photography.I am very happy with this camera for professional photography introducing me, I recommend it has a very good performance.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: praveen
Reviews.Content: still learning buts its an amazing camera. Works exactly as depicted. vibrant colors and great clarity. Good that I bought this after reviewing canon and others.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted and more
Reviews.Author: herbman
Reviews.Content: Long time Pentax user but first digital buy. Controls are user friendly. Got outstanding Grand Canyon shots w/o even looking at the manual. I can't think of anything I don't like.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera..!!
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Amazing shots, love the features and can't beat the price.  I can use all my old Pentax lenses on it as well, which is a pretty good saving too.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the beginning enthuasist, with plenty of options to keep even the budding professional occupied.
Reviews.Author: Nischal S. Rana
Reviews.Content: This is my second Pentax camera, this replacing my older Pentax K-r which has and continues to serve me faithfully. The Pentax k-50 however builds upon the older design by adding several additional upgrades. Some Pros/Cons.Pros:- Being fully weather sealed.- 16.3-Megapixel CMOS Sesnsor- In Body, Sensor-Shift Shake Reduction. This is something you find on cameras at twice the price point of the K-50. It also means that the hundreds of thousands of manual lens for Pentax dating back some 40 years (including all K-Mount and Screw type mount) can be used in this camera with the senor shake reduction features.- Very intuitive easy to use interface. You can pick it up and start shooting right away.- Very fast auto-focus acquisition, even in low light. The AF mode has programmable zones so you can meter your shots depending on the environment.- Can shoot at ISO 51000, but that results in high levels of 'noise' in the picture. ISO levels up to 12800 should be sufficient for most shots.- Has 11 preset customizing options for JPEGs in camera. Also has individual settings to tweak 7 other setting like saturation, hue, contras, B&W; etc.- Battery adapter allows the camera to run off AA batteries, though you should ideally use rechargeable NiCad or LiOn batteries. It will chew up regular alkaline AAs.- The build quality and hand grip are solid, all the buttons are placed logically can can be accessed by just your right hand on the fly. Good tactile feel on all the buttons.- Full frame pentaprism viewfinder, basically what you see is what you get.- Full 1080p video.- Customizeable in dozens and dozens of different colors from the Pentax website.The Cons- The continuous Hi mode where you can shoot 30 JPEG frames at 6 FPS has above average loud shutter noise.- There is only a small built in mono microphone located at the top of the flash when shooting video. The sound quality is ok for shooting indoors, but picks up excessive ambient wind noise when shooting outdoors. As of now, there are no attachments for third party microphones.- Pentax was recently acquired by Ricoh Imaging, so long term support is a little suspect.It's a shame Pentax does not spend more on marketing like the big boys (Nikon/Canon). However, if you are willing to go against the conventional trend and are not fully committed to a DSLR system, you cant get a better value than the Pentax. This camera has features that are not available in many others in its price point. The ideal comparison here is with the Nikon D7100 or the Canon EoS 7D, and while the Nikon has a few upgrades like higher MP, the Pentax has it beat in all other features (AF, LiveView, Shooting Modes, In Camera Editing, in body Image Stabilization). In addition, the Pentax also costs nearly 50% less and can use any previous K or S type lens mount. Pentax also has a very active user community online that offer support and guidance, which takes some of the fear out of them being acquired by Ricoh. Actually the biggest knock on this camera is that it is in many ways functionally similar to the K-30, so you might be able to find a better deal on Amazon on a K-30 bundle. This camera though is a solid performer in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: Great picture color and really easy to use with the best price in any DSLR camera in the middle class range.
Reviews.Author: Yan Z. "tianfeiwei"
Reviews.Content: When I mention this camera is middle class, some people may disagree, but it's really is a middle class camera, except the price and the second screen. However, the quality of picture and the color of picture and also the water-resistant is unbeatable in it's class or even higher class competitors. Highly recommended to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great - Pentax support??... still waiting to find out
Reviews.Author: J. Owens
Reviews.Content: I'm relatively new to DSLR cameras. But based off the reviews here and elsewhere I took the plunge on the K-50. When i received my first K-50, I unboxed it and checked everything out, I found that the lithium battery and charger were not in the box. I checked the Amazon and Pentax sites - they both showed them to be included. I also checked a few youtube unboxing videos and they all showed them included.It did come with the AA battery adapter, so I started using the camera. It works great.I contacted Pentax support. After a few days with no response, I contacted Amazon to see how they wanted to handle it. Amazon over-nighted another K-50 to me. This was great... except the new camera had less than the first.The second camera was missing the instruction manuals, serial# cards and more importantly - the lithium battery and charger.A few days later, Pentax replies with a different email address for me to send my inquiry to(why they couldn't forward it is beyond me). I email the new address with the new information that now 2 cameras were received and still no batteries/chargers. I promptly receive this reply: "The K-50 should have come with a D-Li109 lithium battery and BC109 charger kit included in the package from the dealer.  It sounds like the dealer Amazon is using may be selling grey market cameras.  However, our corporate office will mail you a battery and charger kit if you reply with your full US mailing address."I immediately replied with my shipping address. That was 02/25/14... As of 03/26/14, Pentax has still not shipped me a battery and charger like they said they would.Due to being out of town for work, I missed my cutoff for returning the camera. so I am going to keep it. On the flipside, Amazon has 2 aftermarket lithium batteries with a charger for ~$25. So I guess I'll be ordering those.

Reviews.Title: Great mid-level++ camera for entry enthusiast photographer
Reviews.Author: Simon
Reviews.Content: Get a whole lot more camera for a lot less bucks.  Pentax has layed out a sturdy, slightly smaller camera body with controls and options on par with the upper level cameras - in an intuitive mix between Nikon and Camera set ups.  Easy to use, kit lens 18-135 is weather sealed, quiet and adept.  Unless you need stellar video with mike-in or a full-frame camera, this is a great choice.  Solid DSLR, which leaves you with more cash to spend on lenses and accessories.  Pentax's lenses span the decades and and are almost all compatable with this camera.  Tamron and Sigma also produce some excellent options. All in all, this camera is great as an entry DSLR for a photographer who wants to learn and grow into the field.  One day, I may realize I need to move on to a full-frame camera (Pentax doesn't make one..yet), but for now, I'm toting my K50 around with a smile.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: jthorpe
Reviews.Content: this camera takes amazing pictures and  i love the dual dial feature, having dual dials is a massively underrated feature on a lot of cameras. the WR feature was another selling point for me and i can say i have used this camera more because of this feature

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: christina Ruiz
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use. The size of this camera is prefect for me. The quatily is impressive and there are so many options. I'm looking forward to utlizing this product more and more.

Reviews.Title: Pentax K-50
Reviews.Author: Lady D
Reviews.Content: Love It...Love It... My husband gave me this for Christmas.I'm having so much fun with it.  Takes amazing shots andI can even do a moving target.... Awesome for a beginnerlike me, but I'm sure professionals would love it too.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera is everything you would need to begin your photography hobby.  It is solid, the weather seal really comes in handy for the winter time, (much lower operating temp than rival nikon and canon cameras),In body Image Stabilization is pretty nice too, another big upgrade that is not found in the entry level canon/nikon camera.If you are wishy washy on buying outside of the big names, I would say just go for it.  you wont be disappointing (unless you plan on taking your hobby to the professional space down the road)

Reviews.Title: best camera for the money on the market today...
Reviews.Author: silverspurs
Reviews.Content: for the features and quality of build, I believe this is the best deal on a lower end DSLR available today...  I'm loving it.  no regrets here.

Reviews.Title: Pentax
Reviews.Author: gordon fosburg
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a gift.. Recipient loved it and has taken some nice photos.Perhaps a little overpriced. Would use service again. Happy with process. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jared Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Thus is my first DSLR. For me, the camera is great. Easy to use, and easy to grow into. The dual dials was a selling point for me. Water resistance will very much come in handy. I'm not a pro but this is definitely a camera to consider. I have not tried video on it but I don't really care for it either.

Reviews.Title: A very good Camera.
Reviews.Author: Anant Arun Aiyer
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional, I just want to take good pictures and I know a few things about taking good pictures. This camera is perfect for people like me. I was a little skeptical about buying a big camera, as I prefer something small that can be carried in pocket, but I eventually got used to it with the help of the carry bag.Good Speed, a touch geeky with features which let you control a lot of things and also has user friendly modes in cases where you don't know what needs to be done. A good buy for the price and getting weather proofing is a big perk. I used it mainly outdoors in different weather conditions including rain, no change in how it performs.I recommend this camera, Before taking it on a trip I suggest to practice using this camera with its modes, settings and shortcuts in your living room with different light conditions to check what different modes do and how controls work. You can see how pictures change with different settings. You will start liking the camera with more and more use.Best Feature - Motor controlled Focus in lens.Comparing with Nikon D3200 or D5200. Pentax is a better camera for the price.Comparing with Cannon - Higher end models of Cannon which cost more than $1500 are better than Pentax K-50.

Reviews.Title: Excellent DSLR
Reviews.Author: Big Dad
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my son.  His family loves it. Enough said but needed more words

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but I think I've been spoiled by mirrorless
Reviews.Author: S. ross
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that I like Pentax as a brand and have several of their older MF lenses that my dad gave me. The K-50 was a camera that I had been looking forward to for a while, as the weatherproofing and value for the money intrigued me. When the camera arrived, however, I found myself less than thrilled to play with it.Perhaps it was the kit lens or just my copy of the camera in particular (I got it from warehouse deals, so I'm guessing someone else had bought and returned it) but it seemed to hunt for autofocus in casual indoor shooting, something my Nex 6 and D90 don't really do as often. That aside, the camera itself seems well built and sturdy, but it just doesn't feel substantial, take that how you will. I can certainly appreciate the lack of heft when thinking about lugging it around my neck all day, but I also like to feel that my camera has some mass to it. It feels very nikon D40-esque. This is admittedly a personal preference, and I think my four star review demonstrates that my bias does not reflect poorly on the camera. It simply isn't the camera for me. Image quality was good and the lcd display was bright and easy to read. Controls are well-placed and menus are simple and intuitive  (unlike those of the Nex which are terrible). Overall, a very good camera with a lot of features for a good price. Unless you are like me and have some arbitrary and ultimately pointless predefined notion of what a camera should feel like this would be a very good choice for almost anyone.

Reviews.Title: This one stands out in a crowed.
Reviews.Author: John Blaicher
Reviews.Content: It is rugged and weather resistant and I love the color! I hope it performs as good as it looks...

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Andrea J. Slota
Reviews.Content: amazing camera, easy to use. Takes amazing pictures. Totally love it! Would recommend to anyone who loves taking photos. A+++

Reviews.Title: Camera started misbehaving after 3 weeks
Reviews.Author: Gurpreet Singh
Reviews.Content: I was very optimistic about this camera after reading all the positive reviews from everyone on the internet. After a long research I decided to choose Pentax as the brand to start my DSLR journey. My happiness lasted for only 3 weeks. In the fourth week I started to face issues with the mirror in front of the sensor. It would get stuck when clicking a photo causing even the autofocus to fail because the mirror is in the wrong position. Change to the Live View mode and things work fine but while trying to click through the view finder the mirror gets stuck and sometimes the camera itself hangs with no response at all. I chose to differ from the general crowd and have to repent on my decision. I am currently outside US and by the time I return back I would have crossed 30 day mark, so will be in no position to return the camera. Very disappointing. I wish I would have chosen to stick to the more conventional brands like Canon or Nikon.

Reviews.Author: Michele L. Roberts
Reviews.Content: Still getting use to this. This camera replaced my stolen Pentax K10D and this camera works a lot like my old one but I still need to get use to the newer features. I could probably give it a 5 but I have to learn all over again.
